snippet: In a letter to the state’s Public Service Commission, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said the utility should be denied the $450 million rate increase it was seeking.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo, who has been a stern critic of state's utility companies since Hurricane Sandy struck in 2012, says Consolidated Edison should be denied the $450 million rate increase it is seeking; also says its rates should not go up at all next year.
lead_paragraph: In a letter to the state’s Public Service Commission, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said the utility should be denied the $450 million rate increase it was seeking.

headline.main: Cuomo Denounces Con Ed’s Proposed Rate Increase
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Blasts Con Ed Rate Rise
